text: Answer Question 1 (Section A) and three questions from Section B.
Section A carries 33% of the marks and Section B carries 67% of the marks for this paper.
You have 3 hours (plus any pre-agreed individual adjustment) to answer this paper.
Where appropriate (e.g. for formulae, equations, or diagrams) you may hand write or draw on the Inspera paper provided.
<strong>Candidates should not copy and paste figures or content from any other documents.</strong

sub-instructions: Answer all parts (a-o) of Question 1. Each part carries equal marks. Suggested total time: not more than 1 hour. As a guideline, we suggest average answers should be approximately 100 words long.
content: Draw and label a diagram showing the organelles in a typical plant cell.

Why is the maximum genetic distance between any two genes 50 centiMorgan(cM)?

What is the Philadelphia chromosome? Why was its discovery regarded as a significant milestone in cancer research?
What is the role of cyclic AMP in the aggregation of Dictyostelium?
What are Hox genes and how do we know that they are important in animal development?
